meanings.sent1: The school play turned into a fiascoes when the lead actor forgot all his lines.
meanings.sent2: The project was a fiascoes from start to finish, nothing went as planned.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party was a fiascoes, but everyone laughed and had fun anyway.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to bake a cake turned into a fiascoes, with smoke billowing from the oven.
meanings.sent5: The camping trip was a fiascoes, with tents collapsing and food burning.

meanings.definition: An utter mess or chaotic situation.
meanings.sent1: The living room was a fiascoes with toys scattered everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The traffic jam was a fiascoes, cars honking and people shouting.
meanings.sent3: Trying to untangle the Christmas lights turned into a fiascoes, but we eventually got them sorted.
meanings.sent4: The kitchen after the cooking marathon was a fiascoes, pots and pans everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was a fiascoes of papers and books, no one could find anything.
